---
title: "Metabolic Pathway Prediction of Enzymes for Plant"
---

Based on machine learning approach, this tool is use to predict metabolic pathway of enzymes.
<br>

### Tutorial

To use mAppLe tool, you will need:

- OS Linux (tested with Ubuntu 18.04)
- R 3.6.0 or higher
- Memory RAM: 8GB or higher
- MultiCore processor
<br>

Download:
<br>
[mApLe.tar.xz](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1fH1hdf5OEd-0Ad4ZLHg6RmRRGFeE2HlR) - Uncompress in /home/USER
<br>
[mApLe - Reference Manual](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1B8b9sIP_4LHQadQw3MA7Cv9AMmDiUUHj) - How to use mApLe
<br>
[Raw Data](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ggLEkt0HZdw580qwOWGmOfR9fd-fXi6C) - Data used to create the models
<br>
[Attribute Dataset](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1zzsYWDO0r6Dl4qFu77T_wD1nZ7P40lJM) - Dataset used to training, test and validation
<br>
[mApLe-test](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1SjdBV8_WqiP5hA3fe500N4oIc3Enu5LT) - Dataset used in mApLe and DeepEC

<br>
<br>

### About mAppLe
You can visualize the prediction table, plot and a summary of data in mAppLe tool.
<br>
You can download (as compressed file) the results:
- Table of Results;
- Weka files results;
- Plots;
- ARFF files used;
- Attributes generated.
<br>
<br>

<br>
![](mAppLe-Results.jpeg)

<br>
1 - Metabolic pathways analysed.<br>
2 - Identification of sequences and probability results.<br>
3 - Sequence control of mApLe tool and probability results.<br>
